messages.subject: Re: Christian values
messages.msgSnippet: ... Me too, I joined because the description of the group seemed thoughtful and inclusive. I only joined a few weeks ago, maybe not even that long, and since
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, Schafer Vanessa
<psychomom95@...> wrote:
>
> One of the reasons I joined this group, was because it
> was not a religious group. I don't know how all of
> this got started, but I like the group the way it is.
>
> I will probably come under fire for this, but life is
> to short to worry about everything. Have a great day.

Me too, I joined because the description of the group seemed
thoughtful and inclusive. I only joined a few weeks ago, maybe not
even that long, and since the thread about siblings fighting got out
of hand and turned into the Christian Values rant the tone of the
discussion is dismal.
I personally can see that those who have replied to Georgette have
been honest and respectful, but I dont see any of that in return. and
all the upper case writing, thats shouting in computer speak.
I hope that this will settle down and we can continue with the
friendly, helpful and willing to learn attitude that was so apparent
to me when I joined the group.
Thanks! :)

>
> --- Ren Allen <starsuncloud@...> wrote:
>
> > I have now been written off list about Jesus and I'm
> > getting a bit
> > miffed. If anyone has a difference of religious
> > point of view, that's
> > each individuals business. It is NOT ok however, to
> > email people
> > offlist and espouse your religious views (or any
> > other views that
> > could be viewed as harrassment).
> >
> > If you have something you want to discuss, keep it
> > at the list unless
> > it's private business that another person WANTS to
> > discuss with you.
> >
> > Stick to discussing the ideas, not individual
> > people.
> >
> > Consider this a general reminder, for those it
> > applies to. Thank you.
> >
> > Ren
> > learninginfreedom.com
> >
> >
>
>
> Vanessa
>
>
>
>
>
____________________________________________________________________________________
> Bored stiff? Loosen up...
> Download and play hundreds of games for free on Yahoo! Games.
> http://games.yahoo.com/games/front
>

messages.subject: Re: Christian values
messages.msgSnippet: ~~I believe Ms Debra said it best,mam ~~ Yes she did. She stated that SHE believes being Christian and gentle parenting/unschooling work well together and that
messages.messageBody:
~~I believe Ms Debra said it best,mam'~~

Yes she did.
She stated that SHE believes being Christian and gentle
parenting/unschooling work well together and that discussing religion
at the list is unecessary. Exactly what we're all telling you. Deb is
a very gentle mama that does not advocate a "naughty" chair or the
other methods you're defending.

Ren
learninginfreedom.com

messages.subject: Re: Christian values
messages.msgSnippet: ~~iTS A FREE COUNTR DON T LIKE TO TAKE IT THE PRESIDENT~~ I really don t think even President Bush cares about whether you emailed me offlist or not. You are
messages.messageBody:
~~iTS A FREE COUNTR DON'T LIKE TO TAKE IT THE PRESIDENT~~

I really don't think even President Bush cares about whether you
emailed me offlist or not. You are free to think whatever you like,
you are NOT however, free to email me whatever you like.

You are not free to come into my home and start evangalizing either.
Even the President and his cronies would back that. Your email will be
banned from my mailbox, so apparently it's not THAT free of a country.
There are some laws protecting privacy still in place...thank goddess.

Ren
learninginfreedom.com

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Christian values
messages.msgSnippet: I believe Ms Debra said it best,mam Schafer Vanessa  wrote:          One of the reasons I joined this group, was because it was not a
messages.messageBody:
I believe Ms Debra said it best,mam'

Schafer Vanessa <psychomom95@...> wrote: One of the reasons I joined this group, was because it
was not a religious group. I don't know how all of
this got started, but I like the group the way it is.

I will probably come under fire for this, but life is
to short to worry about everything. Have a great day.

--- Ren Allen <starsuncloud@...> wrote:

> I have now been written off list about Jesus and I'm
> getting a bit
> miffed. If anyone has a difference of religious
> point of view, that's
> each individuals business. It is NOT ok however, to
> email people
> offlist and espouse your religious views (or any
> other views that
> could be viewed as harrassment).
>
> If you have something you want to discuss, keep it
> at the list unless
> it's private business that another person WANTS to
> discuss with you.
>
> Stick to discussing the ideas, not individual
> people.
>
> Consider this a general reminder, for those it
> applies to. Thank you.
>
> Ren
> learninginfreedom.com
>
>

Vanessa

was not a religious group. I don't know how all of
this got started, but I like the group the way it is.

I will probably come under fire for this, but life is
to short to worry about everything. Have a great day.

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Christian values
messages.msgSnippet: iTS A FREE COUNTR DON T LIKE TO TAKE IT THE PRESIDENT Ren Allen  wrote:          I have now been written off list about Jesus and I m
messages.messageBody:
iTS A FREE COUNTR DON'T LIKE TO TAKE IT THE PRESIDENT

Ren Allen <starsuncloud@...> wrote: I have now been written off list about Jesus and I'm getting a bit
miffed. If anyone has a difference of religious point of view, that's
each individuals business. It is NOT ok however, to email people
offlist and espouse your religious views (or any other views that
could be viewed as harrassment).

If you have something you want to discuss, keep it at the list unless
it's private business that another person WANTS to discuss with you.

Stick to discussing the ideas, not individual people.

Consider this a general reminder, for those it applies to. Thank you.

Ren
learninginfreedom.com

messages.subject: Christian values
messages.msgSnippet: I have now been written off list about Jesus and I m getting a bit miffed. If anyone has a difference of religious point of view, that s each individuals
messages.messageBody:
I have now been written off list about Jesus and I'm getting a bit
miffed. If anyone has a difference of religious point of view, that's
each individuals business. It is NOT ok however, to email people
offlist and espouse your religious views (or any other views that
could be viewed as harrassment).

If you have something you want to discuss, keep it at the list unless
it's private business that another person WANTS to discuss with you.

Stick to discussing the ideas, not individual people.

Consider this a general reminder, for those it applies to. Thank you.

Ren
learninginfreedom.com
